definitions.definition: A highly flammable , viscous substance , designed to stick to the body while burning , used in warfare as an incendiary especially in wooded areas.

examples: When leaked, the controversial documents proved to be political napalm .

main_definition: A highly flammable , viscous substance , designed to stick to the body while burning , used in warfare as an incendiary especially in wooded areas. [from 1942 ]
